data.title: Past Award Winners - Toronto Film Critics Association
data.meta_description: Toronto Film Critics Association Award winners, including Parasite, Nomadland, Roma, The Florida Project, Moonlight, Carol, Boyhood
data.text:
Previous Rogers Best Canadian Film Award winners

Previous Company 3 Luminary Award winners

Previous Stella Artois Jay Scott Emerging Artist Award winners

Previous Telefilm Canada Emerging Critic Award winners

TFCA Award Winners By Year

Awards are listed by year to reflect the year of the films’ release.

2023

Best Picture: The Zone of Interest

Runners-Up: All of Us Strangers, Killers of the Flower Moon

Rogers Best Canadian Film nominees: BlackBerry directed by Matt Johnson; Humanist Vampire Seeking Consenting Suicidal Person, directed by Ariane Louis-Seize; Solo, directed by Sophie Dupuis

Rogers Best Canadian Documentary nominees: Rojek, directed by Zaynê Akyol; Someone Lives Here, directed by Zack Russell; Swan Song, directed by Chelsea McMullan

Best Director: Jonathan, The Zone of Interest

Runners-Up: Martin Scorsese (Killers of the Flower Moon), Justine Triet (Anatomy of a Fall)

Outstanding Lead Performance: Sandra Hüller, Anatomy of a Fall; Lily Gladstone, Killers of the Flower Moon

Runners-up: Paul Giamatti (The Holdovers), Andrew Scott (All of Us Strangers), Emma Stone (Poor Things), Kôji Yakusho (Perfect Days)

Outstanding Supporting Performance: Ryan Gosling, Barbie, Da’Vine Joy Randolph, The Holdovers

Runners-Up: Robert De Niro (Killers of the Flower Moon), Robert Downey, Jr. (Oppenheimer), Glenn Howerton (BlackBerry), Charles Melton (May December)

Breakthrough Performance: Teyana Taylor, A Thousand and One

Runners-Up: Charles Melton (May December), Dominic Sessa (The Holdovers)

Outstanding Performance in a Canadian Film: Glenn Howerton, BlackBerry

Runners-Up: Jay Baruchel (BlackBerry), Théodore Pellerin (Solo)

Best Adapted Screenplay: Killers of the Flower Moon – Eric Roth, Martin Scorsese

Runners-Up: All of Us Strangers (Andrew Haigh), Poor Things (Tony McNamara)

Best Original Screenplay: Barbie – Greta Gerwig, Noah Baumbach

Runners-Up: Anatomy of a Fall (Arthur Harari, Justine Triet), Past Lives (Celine Song)

Allan King Documentary Award: 20 Days in Mariupol, directed by Mstyslav Chernov

Runners-Up: The Eternal Memory, directed by Maite Alberdi; Four Daughters, directed by Kaouther Ben Hania; Swan Song, directed by Chelsea McMullan

Best International Feature: Fallen Leaves, directed by Aki Kaurisämki

Runners-Up: Anatomy of a Fall, directed by Justine Triet; The Zone of Interest, directed by Jonathan Glazer

Best Animated Feature: Robot Dreams, directed by Pablo Berger

Runners-Up: The Boy and the Heron, directed by Hiyao Miyazaki; Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse, directed by Joaquim Dos Santos, Kemp Powers and Justin K. Thompson

Best First Feature: Rye Lane, directed by Raine Allen-Miller

Runners-Up: American Fiction, directed by Cord Jefferson; Past Lives, directed by Celine Song

Stella Artois Jay Scott Prize: to be announced

Company 3 Luminary Award: to be announced

Telefilm Canada Emerging Critic Award: to be announced

2022- Signature Award Page

Best Picture: Aftersun

Runners-Up: Everything Everywhere All at Once, Women Talking

Rogers Best Canadian Film Award: Riceboy Sleeps, directed by Anthony Shim

Runners-Up: Brother, directed by Clement Virgo; Crimes of the Future, directed by David Cronenberg

Best Director: Charlotte Wells, Aftersun

Runners-Up: Daniels (Everything Everywhere All at Once), Sarah Polley (Women Talking)

Best Actress: Cate Blanchett, Tár

Runners-up: Danielle Deadwyler (Till), Michelle Yeoh (Everything Everywhere All at Once)

Best Actor: Paul Mescal, Aftersun

Runners-Up: Colin Farrell (The Banshees of Inisherin), Brendan Fraser (The Whale)

Best Supporting Actress: Keke Palmer, Nope

Runners-Up: Jessie Buckley (Women Talking), Stephanie Hsu (Everything Everywhere All at Once)

Best Supporting Actor: Ke Huy Quan, Everything Everywhere All at Once

Runners-Up: Brendan Gleeson (The Banshees of Inisherin), Barry Keoghan (The Banshees of Inisherin)

Best Screenplay, Adapted or Original: The Banshees of Inisherin, Martin McDonagh

Runners-Up: Tár, Todd Field; Women Talking, Sarah Polley

Allan King Documentary Award: All the Beauty and the Bloodshed, directed by Laura Poitras

Runners-Up: Fire of Love, directed by Sara Dosa; Moonage Daydream, directed by Brett Morgen

Best International Feature: Saint Omer, directed by Alice Diop

Runners-Up: Decision to Leave, directed by Park Chan-wook; EO, directed by Jerzy Skolimowski

Best Animated Feature: Turning Red, directed by Domee Shi

Runners-Up: Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio, directed by Guillermo del Toro and Mark Gustafson; Marcel the Shell with Shoes On, directed by Dean Fleischer Camp

Best First Feature: Aftersun

Runners-Up: Marcel the Shell with Shoes on, directed by Dean Fleischer Camp; Turning Red, directed by Domee Shi

Stella Artois Jay Scott Prize: Carol Nguyen

Company 3 Luminary Award: Steve Gravestock

Telefilm Canada Emerging Critic Award: Michelle Krasovitski

2021 – Signature Award Page

Rogers Award for Best Canadian Film: Beans

Runners-up: Night Raiders, Scarborough

Best Picture: Drive My Car

Runners-Up: Licorice Pizza, The Power of the Dog
